decoworld.model.world.entities.combat

Class CombatEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.world.entities.WorldEntity
      • decoworld.model.world.entities.combat.StatEntity
        • decoworld.model.world.entities.combat.CombatEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasCombat, HasHealth, HasStats, StatListener, HasLevel, HasLocation, HasRotation, WorldItem, java.lang.Iterable<StatType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AmmoCrate, Arrow, Crate, FastArrow, FountainOfHealth, HealthPack, PlayerPet, PvpEntity, ResourceNode, Ticket, WarriorMob, Yralemounts, Zombiemounts

    public abstract class CombatEntity
extends StatEntity
implements HasCombat, HasLevel
    CombatEntity provides a generic implementation for a WorldItem that inherits the HasCombat interface.

      • equipItem

        public boolean equipItem(EquipablePlayerItem item)
        By P3TE! Equips the desired item - and applies effects that are associated with that item.
        Parameters:
        item - - The item you want to equip.
        Returns:
        true if it is possible to equip the Item. false if the slots are currently full.

      • unequipItem

        public EquipablePlayerItem unequipItem(EquipableSlots.EquipmentSlot slot)
        By P3TE! Un Equips the desired item - and removes effects that are associated with that item.
        Parameters:
        slot - - The EquipmentSlot that you want vacated.
        Returns:
        null - (if there was no Item in that slot. The Item that was in that slot.) EquipablePlayerItem - The item that was previously in that slot.

      • viewItemInSlot

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getHealth

        public double getHealth()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Returns the percentage of remaining health, where a value of 1.0 represents getMaxHealth(). Percentages must always be greater than or equal to zero. To calculate the remaining health as a value: remainingHealth = getHealth() * getMaxHealth() Note: Percentages above 1.0 are valid and represent a temporary health boost above getMaxHealth()
        Specified by:
        getHealth in interface HasHealth
        Returns:
        percentage - the percentage of remaining health

      • getMaxHealth

        public double getMaxHealth()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Returns the maximum health. Must be greater than 0. Note: It is possible to go over the maximum health when getHealth() returns a value greater than 1.0. This case represents a temporary health boost.
        Specified by:
        getMaxHealth in interface HasHealth
        Returns:
        maxHealth - the "maximum" health

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth(double percentage)
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth
        Sets the percentage of remaining health irrespective of any defense or healing bonuses. Sets the percentage of remaining health (see getHealth()) without taking defense or healing bonuses into account. Percentages must always be greater than or equal to zero. Do not use this method to damage or heal the object. Instead, implement the HasCombat interface and use a HealthEffect.
        Specified by:
        setHealth in interface HasHealth
        Parameters:
        percentage - - the percentage of remaining health

        public boolean isDead()
        Description copied from interface: HasHealth

        Specified by:
